page.title: 18BROMYARD'S POLICE FORCE
page.content: The{Police Force in Bromyard}was founded in 1850. In 1970 the Police Station moved to its present site in{New Road.}The {Magistrates' Court}now occupies its former site in{Church Street. When not on foot patrol, the policemen patrol outlying villages in cars. The Force covers an area of a 7_mile radius. Bromyard Police Station has two sub_stations:{Burley Gate}and {Bredenbury. People not detained overnight at Bromyard are sent to{Leominster, although '999' calls are routed through{Hereford.}Bromyard Station is fully_manned from 09:00 to 17:00 hours but at least one police person is on duty at all times. Bromyard has three police constables and one sergeant.
